bitfield.description: Module ID
RTL version
Major revision
Minor revision

Configures the Number of Taps (Phases) of the RX clock that is supported. The Tuning State machine uses this information to select one of the Taps (Phases) of the RX clock during the Tuning Procedure.

Determines the Wakeup Signal Generation Mode. 0: Synchronous Wakeup Mode: The xin_clk has to be running for this mode. The Card Insertion/Removal/Interrupt events are detected synchronously on the xin_clk and the Wakeup Event is generated. The Assertion and deassertion of the wakeup Event signal synchronous to xin_clk. 1: Asyncrhonous Wakeup Mode: The xin_clk and the host_clk can be stopped in this mode and the Wake up Event is asynchronously generated based on the Card Insertion/Removal/Interrupt Events. The Assertion and deassertion of the wakeup Event signal is asynchronous.
FMUL for the CQ Internal Timer Clock Frequency
FVAL for the CQ Internal Timer Clock Frequency
Slot Type. Should be set based on the final product usage. 00 - Removable SCard Slot, 01 - Embedded Slot for One Device, 10 - Shared Bus Slot, 11 - Reserved.
Asynchronous Interrupt Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The Core supports monitoring of Asynchronous Interrupt).
1.8V Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The 1.8 Volt Switching is supported by Core). Optionally can be set to 1'b0 if the application doesn't want 1.8V switching (SD3.0).
3.0V Support. Should be set based on whether 3.0V is supported on the SD Interface.
3.3V Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 as the 3.3 V is the default voltage on the SD Interface.
Suspend/Resume Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The Suspend/Resume is supported by Core). Optionally can be set to 1'b0 if the application doesn't want to support Suspend/Resume Mode.
SDMA Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The SDMA is supported by Core). Optionally can be set to 1'b0 if the application doesn't want to support SDMA Mode.
High Speed Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The High Speed mode is supported by Core).
ADMA2 Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The ADMA2 is supported by Core). Optionally can be set to 1'b0 if the application doesn't want to support ADMA2 Mode.
8-bit Support for Embedded Device. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The Core supports 8-bit Interface). Optionally an be set to 1'b0 if the Application supports only 4-bit SD Interface.
Max Block Length. Maximum Block Length supported by the Core/Device. 00: 512 (Bytes), 01: 1024, 10: 2048, 11: Reserved.
Base Clock Frequency for SD Clock. This is the frequency of the xin_clk.
Timeout Clock Unit. Suggested Value is 1'b0 (KHz).
Timeout Clock Frequency. Suggested Value is 1 KHz. Internally the 1msec Timer is used for Timeout Detection. The 1msec Timer is generated from the xin_clk.
1.8V VDD2 Support.
ADMA3 Support.

Clock Multiplier. This field indicates clock multiplier value of programmable clock generator. Refer to Clock Control register. Setting 00h means that Host Controller does not support programmable clock generator. FFh Clock Multiplier M = 256, ...., 02h Clock Multiplier M = 3, 01h Clock Multiplier M = 2, 00h Clock Multiplier is Not Supported.
Re-Tuning Modes. Should be set to 2'b00 as the Core supports only the Software Timer based Re-Tuning.

Use Tuning for SDR50. This bit should be set if the Application wants Tuning be used for SDR50 Modes. The Core operates with or with out tuning for SDR50 mode as long as the Clock can be manually tuned using tap delay.
Timer Count for Re-Tuning. This is the Timer Count for Re-Tuning Timer for Re-Tuning Mode 1 to 3. Setting to 4'b0 disables Re-Tuning Timer.
Driver Type 4 Support. This bit should be set based on whether Driver Type 4 for 1.8 Signalling is supported or not.
Driver Type D Support. This bit should be set based on whether Driver Type D for 1.8 Signalling is supported or not.
Driver Type C Support. This bit should be set based on whether Driver Type C for 1.8 Signalling is supported or not.
Driver Type A Support. This bit should be set based on whether Driver Type A for 1.8 Signalling is supported or not.
DDR50 Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The Core supports DDR50 mode of operation). Optionally can be set to 1'b0 if the application doesn't want to support DDR50.
SDR104 Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The Core supports SDR104 mode of operation). Optionally can be set to 1'b0 if the application doesn't want to support SDR104.
SDR50 Support. Suggested Value is 1'b1 (The Core supports SDR50 mode of operation). Optionally can be set to 1'b0 if the application doesn't want to support SDR50.
Maximum Current for 1.8V.
Maximum Current for 3.0V.
Maximum Current for 3.3V.
Maximum Current for 1.8 V (VDD2).
Preset Value for Initialization.
Preset Value for Default Speed.
Preset Value for High Speed.
Preset Value for SDR12.
Preset Value for SDR25.
Preset Value for SDR50.
Preset Value for SDR104.
Preset Value for DDR50.
Idle signal to enable S/W to gate off the clocks.
DMA_CTRL Debug Bus.
CMD_CTRL Debug Bus.
TXD_CTRL Debug Bus.
RXD_CTRL Debug Bus (SD CLK).
RXD_CTRL Debug Bus (RX CLK).
TUN_CTRL Debug Bus.
IO mux enable. Set 1 for GPIO. Set 0 for eMMC/SD
Output Tap Delay Enable. Enables manual control of the TX clock tap delay, for clocking the final stage flops for maintaining Hold requirements on EMMC Interface.
Output Tap Delay Select. Manual control of the TX clock tap delay for clocking the final stage flops for maintaining Hold requirements on EMMC Interface.

Input Tap Change Window. It gets asserted by the controller while changing the itapdlysel. Used to gate of the RX clock during switching the clock source while tap is changing to avoid clock glitches.
Input Tap Delay Enable. This is used for the manual control of the RX clock Tap Delay in non HS200/HS400 modes.
Input Tap Delay Select. Manual control of the RX clock Tap Delay in the non HS200/HS400 modes.
Clock Delay Buffer Select. Selects one of the eight taps in the CLK Delay Buffer based on PVT variation.
